SENT.plain: In patients with multifocal choroiditis, presumed ocular histoplasmosis syndrome (POHS) is often diagnosed
However, POHS typically is not associated with inflammatory activity in the ocular media
A group of patients had a pattern of multifocal choroidal spots reminiscent of POHS with active signs of inflammation in the anterior and vitreous chambers
In addition to inflammation, many patients had peripapillary atrophy (39%) or diskiform macular scars (32%)
Of those with diskiform scars, 33% were black
Systemically, 32% of the patients were presumed to have sarcoidosis; 29%, tuberculosis; 11%, syphilis; and 28%, no etiology
In some cases, treatment of the underlying disease resulted in improvement of the ocular findings
Inflammatory pseudohistoplasmosis syndrome appears to be a nonspecific response to a number of uveitic syndromes, including sarcoidosis, tuberculosis, and syphilis
